name: flex
title: FLEX – Favslist Expansion
author: Woodrow Shigeru
description: Customize and expand your Favslist experience.

preferences.name: hide_ticker
preferences.title: General » Hide ticker and social buttons
preferences.description: I personally find them all annoying. Your call.

preferences.name: expand_clickarea
preferences.title: General » Expand click-area
preferences.description: You can now click on the *entire* box area, not just the text/image. This not only affects the items in the master-search but also those mini-boxes all over FL.

preferences.name: fix_submit_search
preferences.title: General » Submit single search result, ignore submit if more results.
preferences.description: By FL default, if you submit a master-search it redirects you to the front page, regardless of the search results. I deactivated that. And as a bonus, single search results will be detected and handled accordingly. (buggy)

preferences.name: paint_history
preferences.title: General » Change generic "Favslist" in browser history
preferences.description: Where possible, I dynamically replaced the generic text with something more informative.

preferences.name: leftright_paging
preferences.title: General » Browse with left|right arrow keys
preferences.description: The Problem: The pagination of multi-page areas, i.e. forum threads, is often out of immediate reach. — My Solution: Now you can also go prev|next with the left|right arrow keys on your keyboard. Convenience!

preferences.name: toggle_spoilertitle
preferences.title: General » Adjust Spoiler-links
preferences.description: Togglingly adds a distinction between opened and closed spoilers, saying "Hide" instead of "Show".

preferences.name: slapon_accesskeys
preferences.title: General » Attach accesskeys
preferences.description: The Problem: Favsland doesn't use HTML accesskeys. — My Solution: I'll add some, then. — So far, only this: [s] —› master-search

preferences.name: search_for_lists
preferences.title: General » Search for Lists
preferences.description: I know that many have asked for this and I´ve made it happen: you can now textually search for available Lists.

preferences.name: stop_happening
preferences.title: Front Page » Stop "Happening Now" Automation
preferences.description: Stops the broken "Happening Now" box automation.

preferences.name: soc_filter
preferences.title: Search or Create » Category Filter
preferences.description: Filter the search results by category. It dynamically offers only the categories that are present in the results.

preferences.name: rp_filter
preferences.title: Browsing /pages/ » Category Filter for Recent Pages
preferences.description: Filter the Recent Pages by category.

preferences.name: viewpage_fixstyling
preferences.title: Viewing a Page » Fix styling
preferences.description: Provide a minimum height for bare Pages that you can rate but have no comments or side info.

preferences.name: apply_gender_to_cat
preferences.title: Viewing a Page » Apply gender to category
preferences.description: The Problem: The category always says "Actor/Actress" regardless of gender. — My Solution: I make it so that it instead says either "Actor" or "Actress", if possible.

preferences.name: quicklinks
preferences.title: The array of user-chosen Quicklinks.

preferences.name: custom_quicklinks
preferences.title: Adding a Page » Custom Quicklinks
preferences.description: The Problem: The current selection is too static and not suitable for everyone. — My Solution: Users can customize them themselves via a drag and drop overlay menu.

preferences.name: radio_vs_quicklinks
preferences.title: Adding a Page » Either Combobox or Quicklink
preferences.description: Fixes that, most unfavorably, you can have both selected at the same time: a quicklink and a combobox item. Which messes up the subsequent navigation of the category tree.

preferences.name: category_tree
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Category Tree
preferences.description: Provides an always-current, clickable, in-document-searchable tree representing the current category system in use in FL.

preferences.name: yt_quickpaste
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Clean paste of YouTube-links
preferences.description: Conveniently reduces a full YouTube-link pasted from the clipboard (possibly containing additional playlist-/etc.-information) to the mere YouTube-ID. — (buggy in the "Song › Music Clip" field)

preferences.name: textfocus_on_tabswitch
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Auto-focus form-field on tab-switch
preferences.description: When switching categories, automatically focus the first available text field for a faster editing workflow.

preferences.name: losefocus_on_submit
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Lose focus on submit
preferences.description: DEACTIVATED — When submitting the form (with the Enter key) while you're inside an input field or combobox, automatically lose that focus. This makes it easier in Opera to use the hotkeys [1] and [2] to navigate to the neighbor tabs (and start editing the next prepared Page). Super convenient, imho.

preferences.name: clickable_edit_minibox
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Provide a preview link for each minibox in this environment
preferences.description: The Problem: Everywhere where shows up in the Favsland, you can click on a minibox and it'll take you to its Page. It acts like a link. Everywhere except in the Edit-a-Page environment (i.e. the search). Because clicking on the minibox rather "selects" it. — My Solution: I'm adding an extra button/link specifically in this environment. — (alpha)

preferences.name: create_at_top
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Closer "Quick Create" link
preferences.description: When searching for other Pages while editing (i.e. a movie's actors), bring the 'Quick Create' link closer to the search field.

preferences.name: losefocus_trackno
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Move focus when switching browser tabs (album tracklist)
preferences.description: DEACTIVATED — When editing an album's tracklist and leaving the browser tab, then returning (i.e. in order to fill the clipboard with the next track title), the focus is automatically moved from the track no. combobox to the text field.

preferences.name: date_quickpaste
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Quick paste of dates
preferences.description: The Problem: Dates are splitted into a combination of three comboboxes/fields, making copy & paste impossible. — My Solution: I'm adding an intermediate field that translates "date strings" into information that is comprehensible by these three comboboxes/fields.

preferences.name: quicken_album_tracklist
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Quicken Album Tracklist
preferences.description: The Problem: The tracks of a music album have to be added, typed, copy-pasted, whatever-ed one by one. — My Solution: I replaced some of the typing with more convenient clicking.

preferences.name: track_plusplus
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Track++
preferences.description: The Problem: When adding tracks to an album one by one, you have to manually set the track number, even though you're most probably adding the tracks in numerical order. — My Solution: I'm making that selection *for* the user, programmatically.

preferences.name: prevnext_category
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Change category with keyboard
preferences.description: The Problem: Frequently having to change from using keyboard+mouse to using the keyboard alone back and forth can be a hassle if you're editing many Pages in succession. — My Solution: Change to the next|previous category content via an [ALT + PAGE-UP|DOWN] press.

preferences.name: eap_submit
preferences.title: Editing a Page » Edit-a-Page Submit
preferences.description: I'm modifying the appearance of the Submit button in this environment.

preferences.name: expand_recentlists
preferences.title: Browsing /lists/ » Expand Recent Lists
preferences.description: The Problem: The Recent Lists list lists only three lists. This is particularly a problem if you've been away from FL for more than a week and there have been quite a few new lists by now. — My Solution: I'm listing 'em all, in increments of three. But only if the user really wants to browse them.

preferences.name: sorfilcat_gamingplats
preferences.title: Browsing /lists/ » Sort | filter | highlight "Gaming by System".
preferences.description: The Problem: Displaying all gaming platforms at once can be a bit overwhelming when you're searching something specific. — My Solution: I'm adding a few gizmos so that users can apply dynamic filters to the list. — (alpha)

preferences.name: activate_abc
preferences.title: Editing a List » Activate ABC
preferences.description: Highlights the currently selected letter (if any).

preferences.name: editlist_fix_scrolltop
preferences.title: Editing a List » Scroll back up!
preferences.description: Make the left box scroll back up when a long list of new content is loaded.

preferences.name: provide_preview
preferences.title: Editing a List » Provide Preview Link
preferences.description: Provides a convenient one-click way of opening a Page in another tab real quick, without the need to manually search or temporarily rank or anything.

preferences.name: article_readability
preferences.title: Editing a List » Article Readability
preferences.description: Let users toggle between the notations "The Example" and "Example, The" – for better readability. (Unfortunately, can't make this setting permanent)

preferences.name: fix_long_eligibility
preferences.title: Editing a List » Fix the Height of the Eligibility Requirements
preferences.description: The "List Eligibility Requirements" box tears apart the site design when it has long content.

preferences.name: optimize_olist_jumper
preferences.title: Editing a List » Optimize the "Check another list" Jumper
preferences.description: Reduces the redundancy inside the "jump to other lists" combobox a bit, thus making it a bit prettier and easier to read. — (alpha)

preferences.name: categorize_eal
preferences.title: Editing a List » Categorize Edit-a-List
preferences.description: The Problem: Browsing items you want to rank just alphabetically can be a bit of a hassle – especially since there's sometimes already a category at hand. — My Solution: I grab all the categories (*of the current selection!*) and list them in a clickable manner, so that only a segment is listed. I.e. all Britney Spears songs.

preferences.name: preview_pane
preferences.title: Editing a List » Preview Pane
preferences.description: The Problem: The native preview thumbnail is great, but it often gets in the way. — My Solution: There's plenty of room on the right side. (See? I'm thinking *outside the box* ;^)

preferences.name: assisted_pagination
preferences.title: Editing a List » Assisted Pagination
preferences.description: The Problem: The super slim scroll bar is too awkward to use most of the times, especially without a mouse wheel (i.e. on notebooks). — My Solution: Without replacing anything, I add buttons to click, making it seem like you browse a continuous list *in paginated steps*. – Don't let the appearance fool you, btw. The click area is much more generous than the slim button makes it out to be.

preferences.name: self_jumper
preferences.title: Viewing a User Profile » "View own List"
preferences.description: When browsing another user's list (any list) or the combined chart, provide a button to instantly jump to the display of your own list.

preferences.name: fix_thumb_aspectratio
preferences.title: Viewing a User Profile » Fix broken aspect ratio in thumbnails
preferences.description: The Problem: Many thumbnails all over FL have a broken aspect ratio. — My Solution: I've started fixing this. For now, only when viewing a user's list.

preferences.name: forumbox_vertscroll
preferences.title: Forum » Vertical scrollbar in post editor
preferences.description: Lets you scroll your unfinished posts! INSANITY ensues …

preferences.name: anchor_consider_menu
preferences.title: Forum » Fix the forum timestamps
preferences.description: The Problem: Hashtagged links, most prominently forum timestamps, are scrolled to the very top of the screen, which is the default browser behavior, but FL uses a menu bar that lies on top of everything, so the posts are always partly cut off. — My Solution: Make any forum timestamps consider the menu height. — As a bonus, I am also highlighting the post in question.

preferences.name: thereare_followupposts
preferences.title: Forum » There are follow-up posts!
preferences.description: The Problem: Users often fail to notice that the last post display is in fact *not* the last post in the thread. The links/buttons are styled in gray, and gray on gray is hard to say— err, see. — My Solution: I am modifying the necessary CSS.

preferences.name: fix_fanpage_admin
preferences.title: Brands/Fans » Fix the brand/fan page header
preferences.description: The Problem: The fan page header has broken CSS for fan page admins if you hover with the mouse over it. — My Solution: I'm fixing it.

preferences.name: sort_filters
preferences.title: Extra » Sort my Category Filters
preferences.description: Lets you sort my Category Filter alphabetically, instead of using the dynamic order in dependence of the Pages. — This option affects both filters, 'Search or Create' as well as 'Recent Pages'.

preferences.name: debug_off
preferences.title: Extra » Hide debug box
preferences.description: Woody forgot to hide his annoying crap (›‹ )
